s2.ptxt: Install the lock nut and clevis to the push rod.

atten4.ptxt: Tighten the lock nut to the specified torque when adjusting the clutch pedal.

s2.ptxt: Install a new gasket and the clutch master cylinder assembly with the 2 nuts.
Install the clutch pedal (see page ).

s-1.ptxt: CONNECT CLUTCH MASTER CYLINDER TO FLEXIBLE HOSE TUBE

s2.ptxt: Using a union nut wrench, connect the tube.

atten3.ptxt: Use the formula to calculate special torque value for situations where a union nut wrench is combined with a torque wrench (See page ).

s2.ptxt: Connect the clutch reservoir hose with the clip to the clutch master cylinder.

atten3.ptxt: Connect the clutch reservoir hose so that it is not twisted.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL LOWER INSTRUMENT CLUSTER FINISH PANEL

s2.ptxt: Attach the 7 claws to install the lower instrument cluster finish panel.

s-1.ptxt: BLEED AIR FROM CLUTCH PIPE LINE

s2.ptxt: Remove the brake master cylinder reservoir filler cap assembly.
Add brake fluid to keep the level between the MIN and MAX lines of the reservoir while bleeding the clutch line.

specitem.ptxt: SAE J1703 or FMVSS No. 116 DOT3

s2.ptxt: Remove the bleeder plug cap.
Connect a vinyl tube to the bleeder plug.
Depress the clutch pedal several times, and then loosen the bleeder plug with the pedal depressed.
At the point when fluid stops coming out, tighten the bleeder plug, and then release the clutch pedal.
Repeat the previous 2 steps until all the air in the fluid is completely bled out.
Tighten the bleeder plug.
Install the bleeder plug cap.
Check that all the air has been bled out of the clutch line.
Check for brake fluid leaks.
Check the brake fluid level in the reservoir (See page ).
Install the brake master cylinder reservoir filler cap assembly.

s-1.ptxt: INSPECT AND ADJUST CLUTCH PEDAL ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Lift up the floor carpet to expose the asphalt sheet under the pedal.
Check that the pedal height is correct.

spec.title: Standard pedal height from dash panel

s2.ptxt: Adjust the pedal height.

s3.ptxt: Loosen the lock nut and turn the stopper bolt until the pedal height is within the specified range.

s2.ptxt: Check the pedal free play and push rod play.

atten4.ptxt: Pay close attention to the change in resistance to distinguish between pedal free play and push rod play while performing the inspection.

s3.ptxt: Depress the clutch pedal until resistance is felt.
Measure the distance between the pedal's released position and the position in the previous step.
Release the pedal. Using your finger, gently press the pedal until resistance increases slightly.
Measure the distance between the pedal's released position and the position in the previous step.

spec.title: Standard push rod play at pedal top

s2.ptxt: Adjust the pedal free play and push rod play.

atten4.ptxt: The push rod play can be adjusted by changing the length of the push rod. Pedal free play changes together with push rod play.

s3.ptxt: Loosen the lock nut and turn the push rod until the pedal free play and push rod play are within the specified ranges.

atten3.ptxt: If pedal free play and push rod play are not within the standard range even after adjustment, inspect the related parts.

s3.ptxt: After adjusting the pedal free play and push rod play, check the pedal height.

s2.ptxt: Check the clutch release point.

s3.ptxt: Pull the parking brake lever and use wheel chocks to stabilize the vehicle.
Start the engine and run it at idle.
Without depressing the clutch pedal, slowly move the shift lever to R until the gears contact.
Gently depress the clutch pedal and measure the stroke distance from the point that the gear noise stops (release point) up to the full stroke end position.
If the distance is not as specified, perform the following operations.

item.ptxt: Check push rod play and pedal free play.

s2.ptxt: Check the fluid level and add fluid if necessary.

specitem.ptxt: SAE J1703 or FMVSS No. 116 DOT3

atten4.ptxt: Add fluid to a level between the reservoir's MIN and MAX lines.
